application_type_full: Householder planning & demolition in a conservation area
decision_conditions: The development hereby permitted shall begin before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.Reason: This is required by Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

The development to which this permission relates shall be carried out in accordance with the materials specified on the approved plans and on the submitted application form unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority.Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion of the development, in accordance with Policy D3 of the London Plan 2021 and Policies CS8 and DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

Notwithstanding the requirements of Condition 3, prior to the commencement of any development above ground level, manufacturers details of the materials to be utilised for the oriel window frames in the front elevation to which this permission relates shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. The manufacturers details shall include dimensions, depth of profiles, colour and finish/grain. The development shall then be carried out in accordance with the approved details.Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion of the development and to prevent harm to the significance of designated heritage assets, in accordance with Policies D3 and HC1 of the London Plan 2021 and Policies CS8, DM10 and DM12 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.
description: Alteration to front oriel window, rear patio door, and installation of roof-lantern in existing single storey rear extension.
